intro: Scabiosa columbaria subsp. suaveolens, commonly known as sweet scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and grasslands. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to wildlife gardens.
